channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Gulf Coast Community Foundation elects new board chair and vice chair
item.description: The board of directors of theGulf Coast Community Foundationrecently electedAnand Pallegaras chair andRose-Anne Franoas vice chair for one-year terms as officers.

item.title: Fly away! Breeze adds 19 new routes, including several from Florida
item.description: Sometimes you just need to get away. Even if where you are is where others head to when they want to get away.

item.title: Open kitchen shelves may look great, Marni says, but are they for you?
item.description: I know it’s tempting. You see those clean, uncluttered open shelves in kitchens, with their matching ceramic dishes, beautifully staged glassware, lots of negative space, and you think, “Why not? If my kitchen had open shelving, my belongings would look great, too! Plus, everything would be so easy to reach.”

item.title: Marni's sentimental guide to giving the past a presence in our homes
item.description: Over the years, I have earned the reputation as the stuff police. I am forever nagging you to purge, declutter, toss, donate, edit, dump, oust, clear, lighten up and let go. But today, sit down, I am going to sentimentally suggest that some old things you should keep.

item.title: Troubled student finds a love of words in FST’s ‘Dorothy’s Dictionary’
item.description: Troubled student finds a love of words in FST’s ‘Dorothy’s Dictionary’

item.title: International visitors to Florida's national parks will pay more
item.description: Visiting Florida'snational parkswill become a little pricier for those traveling from other countries.

item.title: Football Recruiting 2026: Florida high school summer…
Was Cierra kicked off 'Love Island USA'? See who Nic…
item.description: Five words heard around the country last night — "Cierra has left the villa." Will Nic find a connection with Olandria in the last week of the show?

item.title: VOTE: Who should we have picked as Sarasota, Manatee…
item.description: The Sarasota Herald-Tribuneheld its annual Sarasota-Manatee High School Sports Awards Show on May 30 at the Van Wezel Performing Arts Hall. During the show, we announced Venice High football coach John Peacock as our 2024-25 Boys Coach of the Year.

item.title: VOTE: Who should we have picked as Sarasota, Manatee…
item.description: The Sarasota Herald-Tribuneheld its annual Sarasota-Manatee High School Sports Awards Show on May 30 at the Van Wezel Performing Arts Hall. During the show, we announced Cardinal Mooney Catholic basketball coach Marlon Williams as our 2024-25 Girls Coach of the Year.

item.title: Parrish man, 19, dies after being struck by pickup on U…
item.description: A 19-year-old Parrish man was killed when he was struck by a pickup after he entered the southbound lane of U.S. 301 on foot.

item.title: How will North Port pay for construction of three projects?
item.description: NORTH PORT – The North Port City Commission will discuss a public-private partnership proposal from a Tampa-based company at 6 p.m. Tuesday to build three key infrastructure projects votersopted not to approve bond funding for during a May 13 special election referendum.

item.title: Vote: Who is Sarasota-Manatee's all-time best state championship softball team
item.description: The Herald-Tribune has gone back and documented the fast-pitch softball teams that have won state championships.

item.title: Sarasota County Affordable Housing: Study, Manatee success show possible path forward
item.description: As the Sarasota County Commission plans to sit down early this fall to tackle a raging housing crisis, it will do so armed with plenty of feedback on what works, some of it from affordable housing developers that are having an impact in Manatee County.

item.title: Sarasota doughnut shop permanently closes one of its locations
item.description: Sarasota doughnut shop permanently closes one of its locations
